item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, October 31, 2024 at 1:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenZFS deduplication is good now and you shouldn't use it (133 points | 71 comments)
2. Generative AI Scripting (38 points | 4 comments)
3. Chain-of-Thought Can Hurt Performance on Tasks Where Thinking Makes Humans Worse (166 points | 58 comments)
4. Hi Google, please stop pooping the bed: a desperate plea from the indie web (119 points | 68 comments)
5. It Might Be Possible to Detect Gravitons After All (27 points | discuss)
6. Wonder Animation – Video to 3D Animation (28 points | 1 comment)
7. AI Flame Graphs (172 points | 60 comments)
8. Steam games will need to disclose kernel-level anti-cheat on store pages (424 points | 259 comments)
9. Crafting Painterly Shaders (105 points | 1 comment)
10. SimpleQA (110 points | 35 comments)
11. Google CEO says more than a quarter of the company's new code is created by AI (241 points | 388 comments)
12. Show HN: AI OmniGen – AI Image Generator with Consistent Visuals (88 points | 19 comments)
13. Pushing the frontiers of audio generation (165 points | 65 comments)
14. Rubocop-obsession: RuboCop extension focused on higher-level concepts (54 points | 22 comments)
15. An Italian 'fruit detective' who investigates centuries-old paintings (42 points | 6 comments)
16. Google's TOS doesn't eliminate a user's Fourth Amendment rights, judge rules [pdf] (263 points | 196 comments)
17. M4 MacBook Pro (669 points | 906 comments)
18. Show HN: G-win – .gcode parser written in Rust with winnow (8 points | discuss)
19. Show HN: Ezcrypt – A file encryption tool (simple, strong, public domain) (26 points | 34 comments)
20. First H5N1 Detections in Swine (32 points | 4 comments)
21. Launch HN: FlyCode (YC S22) – Stop losing revenue due to failed payments (68 points | 55 comments)
22. Infisical (YC W23) is hiring full stack engineers (remote or in SF) ( | hide)
23. DeepSeek v2.5 – open-source LLM comparable to GPT-4, but 95% less expensive (110 points | 30 comments)
24. Ask HN: Local RAG with private knowledge base (27 points | 8 comments)
25. Representing web applications as knowledge graphs (57 points | 6 comments)
26. Show HN: LlamaPReview – AI GitHub PR reviewer that learns your codebase (74 points | 26 comments)
27. Australia/Lord_Howe is the weirdest timezone (934 points | 385 comments)
28. Show HN: Routing24 – Free route optimization in the browser (29 points | 13 comments)
29. Fruits (2020) (127 points | 22 comments)
30. NASA reconnected with Voyager 1 after a brief pause (205 points | 134 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, October 31, 2024 at 1:15 AM UTC
